pull_request.title: Fix #198008 sanet.st
pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198008

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

1. Your comment

Adcash

2. Screenshots

<details>

<summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

<details>

<summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198021

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

1. Your comment

I think the regex

```adb
/^https?:\/\/(?:[a-z]{2}\.)?[0-9a-z]{5,16}\.[a-z]{3,7}\/[a-z](?=[a-z]{0,25}[0-9A-Z])[0-9a-zA-Z]{3,26}\/\d{4,6}(?:\?[_a-z]=[0-9a-z-]+)?$/$subdocument,script,xmlhttprequest,third-party,match-case
```

is discarded with MV3?

comment.body:
AdGuard for Windows unfortunately isn't set to cover every single app on a PC by default (I personally wish it would).

Presuming AdGuard too is running in German on your PC, then it can be set to cover Outlook in "Netzwerk" → "Liste der gefilteren Anwendungen" → "+" → "Nach Anwendung süchen …" → Find `outlook.exe` on your PC and select it.

However, even then would AdGuard struggle a bit with fixing it, as it doesn't support `##`-type entries in non-browser programs.

> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

issue.title: com.dubox.drive
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [x] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Android

### AdGuard version

comment.body:
> [#197989 (comment)](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/197989#issuecomment-2642258276) I assume this is because AdGuard for Android uses optimized filters. However, [the rule](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/197989#issuecomment-2642162131) is in the filter. There might be another element or the site loads as is for some reason.

Ok, that explains the differs in rules. Not so long ago I was missing 1 rule, and after installing Adguard again, I had the correct rules. Thought this was the same problem, but it was not. 😁

>There might be another element or the site loads as is for some reason.

Yes, there is `.mg-slot`, but I see it only after disabling AdGuard.

comment.body:
I think that web browser doesn't matter in this case and it's better to use this one which you prefer, in both AdGuard should works the same/very similar.

I see this element after accepting cookies, so I guess that situation might looks like this (I'm just guessing, maybe it wasn't like that): you had AdGuard disabled and accepted cookies, so now this element is visible. When you enabled AdGuard there still is this element, because we don't have any rule to hide it (I will add `mediacourant.nl##.mg-slot`). After reinstalling Firefox, cookies were cleared so now this element is not visible again.
Or just for some reason HTTPS filtering is disabled in Firefox.

issue.title: teams.microsoft.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [https://teams.microsoft.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fteams.microsoft.com)
### Comment
> Die Teams Android App funktioniert nicht richtig.
> Es dauert mit in den Android Einstellungen aktiviertem dns: DNS.adguard.com einige Sekunden bis die chats geladen sind und nochmal einige bis die statusse der Chatkollegen geladen sind. Häufig werden Nachrichten gar nicht rausgesendet. Oder Mann muss sehr häufig auf erneut senden klicken. Nachrichten werden häufig in der App nur nach wiederholten laden angezeigt. Liegt nicht an der Adguard Android App diese hette ich nicht benutzt.

comment.body:
[There](https://rule34.us/index.php?r=posts/view&id=8434065) seem to be different selectors.
I think the rules are fine without the first part.
```adblock
rule34.us##div[style]:has(> script[class^="__clb-"])
rule34.us##div[style]:has(> center > script[class^="__clb-"])
```

# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [x] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198001

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

1. Your comment

<!-- Please write a comment here -->

2. Screenshots

<details>

<summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

<details>

<summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

I propose: > ``` > ! https://rule34.us/index.php?r=posts/index&q=vacuum_bed+-futa%2a+-scared%2a+-asphy%2a+-tortur%2a+-ampu%2a > rule34.us##.container > center:first-of-type:has(script[onerror]) > rule34.us##center > div[style^="height:"]:has(> center > script[onerror]) > ! (Presumably for AdGuard DNS Filter if it's not there already? _Not_ needed for Base Filter.) > ||oblonnqw.com^ > ! https://rule34.us/index.php?r=posts/view&id=7634942 > rule34.us##.content_push > script + div[style^="height:"] > rule34.us##.content_push > center:has(script[onerror]) > ``` > I did as best as I could to use minus-tags in the first example link to remove the ickiest things, but it's certainly a NSFW site anyway. >
